botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Harmful if ingested and may irritate skin. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Delphinium can be annuals, biennials or perennials, with palmately lobed basal leaves and showy bowl-shaped flowers in spikes, racemes or panicles

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, well-drained soil in full sun. Shelter from strong winds and provide support (see staking: perennials). Divide every 2-5 years to maintain vigour
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division or by basal softwood cuttings in spring or Propagate by seed. As this plant is protected by Plant Breeders' Rights, any propagation should be for personal rather than commercial use
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead spent flower spikes back to fresh flowering side shoots and cut back to ground level in late autumn.
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, slugs, snails, leaf miners and caterpillars
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to delphinium black blotch, Powdery mildews, grey moulds, crown rot (on mature plants)
